webFramework.impact: Complete rewrite of web application required
webFramework.details: Uses System.Web, Razor views, and MVC 5 patterns that are incompatible with .NET Core/.NET 10

wcfServices.modernAlternative: gRPC, REST APIs with ASP.NET Core Web API, or CoreWCF
wcfServices.details: WCF is not supported in .NET Core/.NET 10. Options include migrating to gRPC, REST APIs, or using CoreWCF compatibility layer

msmq.modernAlternative: Azure Service Bus, RabbitMQ, or Azure Queue Storage
msmq.details: MSMQ (System.Messaging) is Windows-specific and not supported in .NET Core/.NET 10. Requires migration to cloud-native messaging

projectFormat.details: All projects use verbose XML-based .csproj format. Modern SDK-style format is more concise and enables better tooling

packageManagement.details: ProductCatalog uses packages.config instead of modern PackageReference format

sessionState.details: Uses Session object for cart storage, incompatible with containerized/stateless architecture

nugetPackages.name: Newtonsoft.Json
nugetPackages.note: Can continue using or migrate to System.Text.Json

frameworkDependencies.name: System.Web
frameworkDependencies.impact: Core ASP.NET MVC dependency, complete rewrite required

frameworkDependencies.name: System.ServiceModel
frameworkDependencies.impact: WCF dependency, service layer redesign required

frameworkDependencies.name: System.Messaging
frameworkDependencies.impact: MSMQ dependency, messaging infrastructure replacement required

architectureConsiderations: Microservices architecture: Split into separate services (Web API, Order Processor)
Stateless design: Replace session storage with distributed cache or client-side state
Cloud-native messaging: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
Service-to-service communication: Replace WCF with REST/gRPC
Container-ready: Add Dockerfile for each service
Health checks: Implement health endpoints for Container Apps
Environment configuration: Use environment variables instead of Web.config/App.config

complexity.justification: High complexity due to multiple incompatible technologies (ASP.NET MVC 5, WCF, MSMQ) that require complete rewrites. The application has good separation of concerns but uses legacy patterns throughout. Estimated 3-4 weeks for experienced team.

frameworkMigration.description: ASP.NET MVC 5 to ASP.NET Core requires complete rewrite of web layer, views, controllers, and configuration

wcfMigration.description: WCF service needs redesign to REST API or gRPC. Repository pattern already exists, simplifying data access migration

messagingMigration.description: MSMQ replacement with Azure Service Bus requires new queue service implementation and OrderProcessor redesign

stateManagement.description: Session-based cart storage needs migration to distributed cache (Redis) or client-side/API-based state

containerization.description: Create Dockerfiles, configure for Azure Container Apps, implement health checks, and externalize configuration

testing.description: No existing tests to migrate. Should add tests during modernization to prevent regressions

phases.name: Foundation & Infrastructure
tasks: Set up .NET 10 solution structure with SDK-style projects
Create new ASP.NET Core Web API project for product service
Migrate data models (Product, Category, Order) to .NET 10
Implement repository pattern with modern patterns (dependency injection)
Set up Azure Service Bus for messaging
Create initial Dockerfiles for each service

phases.name: Service Layer Migration
tasks: Replace WCF service with ASP.NET Core Web API controllers
Implement REST API endpoints for all product operations
Add Swagger/OpenAPI documentation
Migrate OrderProcessor to .NET 10 console app with Service Bus
Implement distributed cache (Redis) for session state
Add health check endpoints for Container Apps

phases.name: Web Application Migration
tasks: Create new ASP.NET Core MVC web application
Migrate views from Razor to ASP.NET Core Razor Pages/Views
Update controllers to use ASP.NET Core patterns
Replace session-based cart with distributed cache or API-based state
Update frontend to call REST API instead of WCF service
Migrate configuration to appsettings.json and environment variables

phases.name: Containerization & Azure Deployment
tasks: Finalize Dockerfiles with multi-stage builds
Create Azure Container Registry resources
Set up Azure Container Apps environment
Configure Azure Service Bus queues and topics
Deploy Redis cache for distributed state
Implement CI/CD pipelines for automated deployment
Configure environment variables and secrets
Set up monitoring and logging (Application Insights)

phases.name: Testing & Validation
tasks: Integration testing of all services
Load testing for Container Apps scalability
Validate message processing with Azure Service Bus
Security testing and vulnerability scanning
Performance benchmarking
User acceptance testing
Documentation updates

risks.mitigation: Ensure data models are thoroughly tested before migration
Use ASP.NET Core Razor which is similar to MVC 5 Razor
Provide training and use Azure SDK samples

risks.risk: Session state migration impact on user experience
risks.mitigation: Use distributed cache (Redis) to maintain session-like behavior
Configure minimum replicas and implement proper warm-up

recommendations.recommendation: Adopt microservices architecture with separate Container Apps for web UI, product API, and order processor
recommendations.benefit: Better scalability, independent deployment, and fault isolation

recommendations.recommendation: Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus
recommendations.benefit: Cloud-native, highly available, and supports advanced messaging patterns

recommendations.recommendation: Implement distributed cache (Azure Redis Cache) for session state
recommendations.benefit: Enables stateless architecture suitable for containers and horizontal scaling

recommendations.recommendation: Replace WCF with REST API using ASP.NET Core Web API
recommendations.benefit: Modern, lightweight, and widely supported. Consider gRPC for internal service-to-service calls

recommendations.recommendation: Add persistence layer with Azure SQL Database or Cosmos DB
recommendations.benefit: Currently data is in-memory. Production needs persistent storage

recommendations.recommendation: Implement Azure AD B2C or Azure AD authentication
recommendations.benefit: Secure, scalable authentication for cloud deployment

recommendations.recommendation: Integrate Application Insights for telemetry and monitoring
recommendations.benefit: End-to-end visibility into application performance and issues

recommendations.recommendation: Set up GitHub Actions workflows for automated build and deployment
recommendations.benefit: Automated testing, building, and deployment to Azure Container Apps

recommendations.recommendation: Consider modern frontend framework (React, Vue, or Blazor) for new features
recommendations.benefit: Better user experience and easier maintenance, though current jQuery/Bootstrap is acceptable

nextSteps: Set up Azure resources (Container Apps environment, Service Bus, Redis)
Set up development and staging environments
Plan data migration strategy if adding persistent storage
